IMAGE-LAND, also referred to as IMAGE-LCM (short for Land Cover Model), is the land-use change component of the IMAGE integrated assessment model (IAM). It is a global land-use change model, comprising 20 different [[Land Cover Types]], with 16 [[Food Crops]] and 5 bioenergy crops.

IMAGE-LAND, alongside the rest of the IMAGE IAM, was initially developed in the 1990s in FORTRAN by the PBL. The most recent version of IMAGE developed by the PBL is IMAGE 3.2, detailed in the IMAGE wiki; the IMAGE 3.0 book discusses a version of the model released in 2014 in more depth.

Why this documentation?

You are now reading the documentation for a novel, open-source package which implements IMAGE-LAND using the LUE framework (GitHub). This package is the result of a collaboration between PBL and the Faculty of Geosciences of Utrecht University.

Keep Reading

To learn more about IMAGE-LAND in general, [[IMAGE-LAND Allocation and Formulae]] discusses the core aspects of the land cover model, including the equations which determine the land allocation process. Descriptions of the model’s inputs and file types can be found in [[Inputs]]. [[Legacy IMAGE-LAND]] describes the way in which the land allocation takes place in the FORTRAN code so that it may be compared to the new implementation. [[Function Request]] offers an overview of the functions that were added to LUE for use in this project.
